meanings.definition: The act of making something English in form or character.
meanings.sent1: The anglicizations of traditional dishes made them more familiar to the locals.
meanings.sent2: She studied the anglicizations of ancient texts to understand their meaning.
meanings.sent3: The anglicizations of the play's dialogue added a humorous touch to the performance.
meanings.sent4: His anglicizations of foreign customs created a bridge between cultures.
meanings.sent5: The anglicizations of the menu items made ordering easier for tourists.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting a foreign word or phrase to English usage.
meanings.sent1: Learning the anglicizations of Spanish words helped her communicate better.
meanings.sent2: The anglicizations of Japanese names made them easier to pronounce for English speakers.
meanings.sent3: The anglicizations of the new terms were a fun challenge for the students.
meanings.sent4: Her anglicizations of French phrases were so accurate that she sounded like a native speaker.
meanings.sent5: The anglicizations of scientific terms simplified complex concepts for the class.

meanings.definition: The practice of using English words or expressions in place of foreign ones.
meanings.sent1: His anglicizations of greetings from other countries made them more universal.
meanings.sent2: The anglicizations of foreign idioms helped the students understand the language better.
meanings.sent3: The anglicizations of the song lyrics gave them a fresh, modern twist.
meanings.sent4: Their anglicizations of traditional dances brought a new energy to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The anglicizations of the legal terms clarified the contract for everyone involved.
